Cum id quod nos venenum appellamus, Graeci <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign> dicunt, apud illos quoque tam medicamenta, quam quae nocent hoc nomine continentur, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:236" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 236</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 48, 8, 3</bibl>.—Obsolete, however, in this general signif.: qui venenum malum fecit fecerit, an old legal formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:54:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 54, 148</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avaritia pecuniae studium habet: ea quasi venenis malis imbuta corpus animum que virilem effeminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50421.3" n="A" level="2"> In a bad sense, like <foreign lang="greek">fa/rmakon</foreign> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n50421.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A potion that destroys life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poison</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venom</hi> (cf. toxicum). </sense><sense id="n50421.5" n="a" level="4"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsius veneni quae ratio fingitur? ubi quaesitum est? quem ad modum paratum? cui, quo in loco traditum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:24:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 24, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">21, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 165</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">61, 169</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:33:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 33, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:40:96" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 40, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobis veratrum est acre venenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:638" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 638</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 514</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 24, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.6" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mischief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">evil</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi> (rare, and not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">discordia ordinum est venenum urbis hujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 67, 6</bibl></cit>: regis Rupili pus atque venenum, i e. <pb n="1968" /> <cb n="VENE" /> <hi rend="ital">virulence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 7, 1</bibl>.—Of bad poems, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:44:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 44, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:77:5" default="NO" valid="yes">77, 5</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">humili veneno laedere aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:171" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venena linguarum, Treb. Poll. Trig. Tyr. 30: lingua est suffusa veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:777" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 777</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.7" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a magical potion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">item ut Medea Peliam concoxit senem: Quem medicamento et suis venenis dicitur Fecisse rursus ex sene adulescentulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dira Medeae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:62" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colcha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Colchica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:37:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 37, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 5, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 209</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 403</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui quodam quasi veneno perficiat, ut veros heredes moveat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:19:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 19, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod amatorium appellatur, venenum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:8:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seduction</hi>: aetas et corpus tenerum et morigeratio, Haec sunt venena formosarum mulierum, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">intactos isto satius tentare veneno (i. e. amore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 3), 19: <cit><quote lang="la">blandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:453" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 453</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:309" default="NO">11, 309</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultum inspires ignem fallasque veneno (i. e. amoris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 688</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50421.9" n="B" level="2"> In a good sense. </sense><sense id="n50421.10" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A coloring material</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dye</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paint</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">alba nec Assyrio fucatur lana veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 465</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 351</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n50421.11" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A drug</hi> used in embalming, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:691" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 691</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veneo: <entryFree id="n50422" type="main" key="ve_ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnĕo</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vaenĕo</orth>), <itype>īvi or ii, ī^tum, 4</itype> (in the <sense id="n50422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> form, venear, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 365</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneatur, Titian. ib.: vaeniri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 28</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">VENIRI,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4388</bibl></cit>; the <hi rend="ital">i</hi> of the supine short, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 907</bibl> P.; scanned long by <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Hymn. 1, 21</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> VENIET, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 512, 14</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imp.</hi> venibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:47:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 47, § 113</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf. inf.</hi> venisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:4:5:20" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> 4, 5, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4, 9</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>venum-eo; v. 2. venus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to go to sale</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be sold</hi> (used as <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> of vendo; <cit><quote lang="la">class.): oleam venire oportet ... oleo venibit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 146</bibl></cit>: auctio fiet; <cit><quote lang="la">venibunt servi, supellex, fundi, aedes, omnia Venibunt, quiqui licebunt ... Venibit uxor quoque etiam, si quis emptor venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:96 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 96 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venibis tu hodie virgo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogis eos plus lucri addere, quam quanti venierant, cum magno venissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:39:section=89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 39, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ei mandasti, cui expediret illud venire quam plurimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 7, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia venibant Saturnalibus tertiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia veneat auro Rara avis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondit, a cive se spoliari malle quam ab hoste venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:43" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:7:12" default="NO">12, 7, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber, quo questus est venire advocationes, venire etiam praevaricationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 13</bibl></cit> (14), 6: <cit><quote lang="la">adicis hos (agros) nongentis milibus posse venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(mullum) missum sibi cum in macellum deferri et venire jussisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 95:42" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 95, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21:27" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:8:15" default="NO">9, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 3, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venerabilis: <entryFree id="n50423" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veneror</etym>. <sense id="n50423.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthy of respect</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">venerabilis vir miraculo litterarum ... venerabilior divinitate credita Carmentae matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos quidem illos ac venerabiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes eloquentiae (with sacrae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50423.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">showing veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverential</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">senatus in deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:15" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba erga deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venerabiliter: <entryFree id="n50424" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>venerabilis, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">assensus his dictis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exceperunt victorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:1:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venerabundus: <entryFree id="n50425" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veneror</etym>, <sense id="n50425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">venerating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverential</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerabundi templum iniere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venerandus: <entryFree id="n50426" type="main" key="ve^ne^randus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of veneror.</entryFree>
veneranter: <entryFree id="n50427" type="main" key="ve^ne^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. veneror <sense id="n50427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> B.</sense></entryFree>
venerarius: <entryFree id="n50428" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. Venus</etym>, <sense id="n50428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venereal</hi> (very rare, for Venereus): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>coition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veneratio: <entryFree id="n50429" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>veneror</etym>, <sense id="n50429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the highest respect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veneration.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">habet enim venerationem justam quicquid excellit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 1</bibl></cit>, praef. § <cit><quote lang="la">4: capita aperire non venerationis causā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter ingenitam illi genti erga reges suos venerationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:6:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 6, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:29" default="NO">6, 6, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:10:2" default="NO">5, 10, 2</bibl>; 7, 8, 4; 10, 5, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:7:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:1:12" default="NO">4, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6:1" default="NO">4, 6, 1</bibl>; 5, 1, 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:7" default="NO">12, 11, 7</bibl>; <cb n="VENE" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:54:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 54, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 1, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 15, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50429.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, object., <hi rend="ital">the quality that commands veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerableness</hi> (only post-Aug.): amici Alexandri ejus virtutis ac venerationis erant, ut singulos reges putares. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:1:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venerator: <entryFree id="n50430" type="main" key="ve^ne^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>veneror</etym>, <sense id="n50430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reverencer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domūs vestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 7, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idolorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venereus: <entryFree id="n50431" type="main" key="Ve^ne^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĕus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. Venus.</entryFree>
venerivagus: <entryFree id="n50432" type="hapax" key="Ve^ne^ri^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭ-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> [1. Venus], <hi rend="ital">vagabond in love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">libidinous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolute</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 46, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venero: <entryFree id="n50433" type="main" key="ve^ne^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. veneror <sense id="n50433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
veneror: <entryFree id="n50434" type="main" key="ve^ne^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n50434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi> [Sanscr. vankh, wish, pray; cf. O. H. Germ. wunsc; Engl. wish; and Lat. Venus, venustas], <hi rend="ital">to reverence with religious awe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to worship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerate.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50434.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50434.2" n="A" level="2"> Of religious worship offered to the gods, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: adoro, colo, revereor): di quos nos colere precari venerarique soleamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:42:119" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 42, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venerari et colere deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 28, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auguste sancteque deos omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 21, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum in precibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum (Epicurum) ut deum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos in deorum numero (with colere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidem e sepulcro pro deo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:40:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 40, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Larem Farre pio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 745</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majestatem naturae deorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa dei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.3" n="B" level="2"> With men or things as objects, <hi rend="ital">to revere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">do homage to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">honor</hi> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">quin omne humanum genus secundum deos nomen Romanum veneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 17, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veneratur illos populus idem colitque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:41:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 41, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Satrium utque Pomponium venerebamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic patris sic mariti memoriam venerari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes qui aliquid in studiis faciunt venerari studeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:17:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 17, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 31, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectacula edentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut humilitas amplitudinem venerari debet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canos ejus et annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5</bibl></cit>, ext. 2: <cit><quote lang="la">principes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:5:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquorum curam diligentiamque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Augustum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (scribentes),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 263</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to ask reverently</hi> for any thing, <hi rend="ital">to beseech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">implore</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beg</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entreat</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supplicate;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc quisquis est deus, veneror, Ut nos ex hac aerumnā miseras eximat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. prol. 8</bibl>; cf. an old formula of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl>: qui multa deos venerati sint contra ejus salutem, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil horum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tu supplicibus me sis venerata tabellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 20</bibl></cit> (3, 13), 33.!*? </sense><sense id="n50434.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> collat, form <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕro</orth>, āre: <cit><quote lang="la">saluto te, vicine Apollo, veneroque te, Ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut venerem Lucinam meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 5, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.6" n="2" level="3"> Veneror, as passive, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 257, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 17, 1</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, in a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">Ceres, Hor, S. 2, 2, 124: Sibylla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 460</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 794</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n50434.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕ-nĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">worthy of veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VENERANDISSIMI CAESARES,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 209, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 38, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50434.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">with veneration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reverently</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adorant omnes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. Judic. Dom. 184</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> 5, 432</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veneti: <entryFree id="n50435" type="main" key="Ve^ne^ti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕti</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Hĕnĕti</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n50435.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people in</hi> Gallia Togata, in the mod. <hi rend="ital">Venetian territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:2" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 19, 23, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 2, 2, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 20, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:606 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 606 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n50435.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n50435.2" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Veneti</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venetian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:88:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 88, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Eridanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: Mantua, Sid. poët. Ep. 9, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence also, Vergilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50435.3" n="b" level="4"> (Perh. taken from the color of the sea on the coast.) <hi rend="ital">Sea-colored</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bluish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucullus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:170" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 170</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:74:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 74, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conditura (piscium in marinā aquā coctorum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 24</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n50435.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Factio, <hi rend="ital">the party clothed in blue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Blues</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕ-nĕtus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">one of the Blue faction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:46:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 46, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:48:23" default="NO">10, 48, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:131:1" default="NO">14, 131, 1</bibl>; v. factio.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the adherents of the Blues</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Blues</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Ver. 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1075, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50435.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtus lăcus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <cb n="VENI" /> <hi rend="ital">portion of the lake of Constance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50435.6" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Veneti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 18, 22, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:76:2 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 76, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50435.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of</hi> Gallia Lugdunensis, <hi rend="ital">in the vicinity of the mod. Vannes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 18, 32, § 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7</bibl> sq.; 3, 16 sq.; 7, 75; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 5</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n50435.8" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Veneti</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50435.9" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕ-nĕtĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Veneti</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venetic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 19, 33, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50435.10" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people of northern Germany</hi>, = Venedi.</sense></entryFree>
venetulani: <entryFree id="n50436" type="main" key="Ve^ne^tu^la_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕtŭlāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an extinct people of Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venia: <entryFree id="n50437" type="main" key="ve^ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>akin to veneror, q. v.</etym>, <sense id="n50437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">complaisance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indulgence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">kindness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obliging disposition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">conduct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mercy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">favor</hi> (class.; cf. indulgentia), most usual in the phrase veniam dare, <hi rend="ital">to grant a favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be favorable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to comply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consent.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50437.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: Jane, Juppiter, Mars pater, etc. ... vos precor, veneror, veniam peto feroque uti populo Romano Quiritium vim victoriamque prosperetis, an old formula of prayer in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 9, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Jove Opt. Max. ceterisque dis pacem ac veniam peto precorque ab iis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Perd. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeso a vobis, ut in hac causā mihi detis hanc veniam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">precor hanc veniam supplici des, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 12, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dabis hanc veniam, mi frater, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar tibi petenti veniam non dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur haec venia antiquitati, ut miscendo humana divinis, primordia urbium augustiora faciat, Liv. prooem. § 7: mi gnate, da veniam hanc mihi: reduc illam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extremam hanc oro veniam, miserere sororis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datur petentibus venia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam petenti dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam quoque a deis spei alicujus audacioris petimus, in sinum spuendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 4, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam mihi quam gravate pater dedit de Chrysalo!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum data esset venia ejus diei,</quote> <trans><tr>when indulgence had been granted for that day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobile illud nepenthes oblivionem tristitiae veniamque afferens,</quote> <trans><tr>a complaisant</tr>, <tr>mild disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50437.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Permission</hi> to do any thing, esp. In phrases: veniam petere (poscere) and veniam dare; <cit><quote lang="la">veniā petitā puerum ad canendum ante tibicinem cum statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere veniam legatis mittendis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam dicendi ante alios exposcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">datā veniā seducit filiam ac nutricem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the context: qui censerent, dandam ceteris veniam talium conjugiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:26" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50437.3" n="C" level="2"> Bonā veniā or cum bonā veniā. </sense><sense id="n50437.4" n="1" level="3"> With audire, <hi rend="ital">kindly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with favor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without prejudice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā veniā me audies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vos oro atque obsecro, judices, ut attente bonāque cum veniā verba mea audiatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā veniā se auditurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum bonā veniā, quaeso, audiatis id quod invitus dico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50437.5" n="2" level="3"> With verbs of saying (mostly parenthet.), <hi rend="ital">by your good leave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with your permission</hi>, <hi rend="ital">without offence</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi vero (bonā veniā hujus optimi viri dixerim) tu, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 57, 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā hoc tuā veniā dixerim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div 1, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atqui, frater, bonā tuā veniā dixerim ista sententia maxime fallit imperitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:15:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonā veniā vestrā liceat, etc., Liv 6, 40, 10: primum abs te hoc bonā veniā peto ... mihi ut respondeas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:3:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 3, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oravit etiam bonā veniā Quirites, ne quis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:41:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 41, 3</bibl></cit>.—Rarely veniā alone: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem ex his, quos eduxeram mecum (veniā sit dicto) ibi amisi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50437.6" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">forbearance</hi> in view of any wrong that has been done, <hi rend="ital">forgiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pardon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remission</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venia est poenae meritae remissio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 2:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errati veniam impetrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem veniamque impetrare a victoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 45, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniam et impunitatem dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui non apud senatum ... maximorum scelerum venia ulla ad ignoscendum duci possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:41:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 41, 98</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:37:131" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 37, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui errato nulla venia, recte facto exigua laus proponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cede deae, veniamque tuis, temeraria, dictis Supplice voce roga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 78</bibl>: aliquem veniā donare <pb n="1969" /> <cb n="VENI" /> in praeteritum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniā dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legere cum veniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:72" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 72</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veniabilis: <entryFree id="n50438" type="main" key="ve^ni^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venia, II.</etym>, <sense id="n50438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pardonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venial</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 943</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> adv. Avar. 4, 8</bibl>; cf. the foll. article.</sense></entryFree>
venialis: <entryFree id="n50439" type="main" key="ve^ni^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venia</etym> (post-class.). <sense id="n50439.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Gracious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 4, 333</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50439.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Pardonable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista translatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam errores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venilia: <entryFree id="n50440" type="gloss" key="ve^ni_li^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnīlĭa</orth> <itype>unda est quae ad litus venit</itype>, Varr. ap. Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 22.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50441" type="main" key="Ve^ni_li^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnīlĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several sea-nymphs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50441.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of Turnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 76</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50441.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The wife of Janus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 334</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venio: <entryFree id="n50442" type="main" key="ve^ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnĭo</orth>, <itype>vēni, ventum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n50442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> venibo, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 508, 23</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">imperf.</hi> venibat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 47</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> sync. venientum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 434</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 755</bibl>), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root gā, go; Zend root gā, gam, go; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*b*a-, bai/nw</foreign>; Lat. ar-biter, venio; Goth. quiman; O. H. Germ. quëman, koman; Engl. come; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Gr. Etym. p. 466" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Gr. Etym. p. 466</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> (cf. accedo). </sense><sense id="n50442.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc, cujus jussu venio et quam ob rem venerim, Dicam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veni, vidi, vici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 37</bibl></cit>: imus, venimus, videmus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">maritimus hostis ante adesse potest quam quisquam venturum esse suspicari queat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad macellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut veni ad urbem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio, te ad me venire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi si spatium fuerit in Tusculanum veniendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cato ... cum venerat ad se in Sabinos,</quote> <trans><tr>had come home</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:28:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 28, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quia nudius quartus venimus in Cariam ex Indiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sexto die Delum Athenis venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italiam fato profugus, Laviniaque venit Litora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumulum antiquae Cereris sedemque sacratam Venimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 743</bibl></cit> (cf. devenio): <cit><quote lang="la">vin' ad te ad cenam veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercator venit huc ad ludos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo ad praetorem deplorabundus venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego te derisum venio neque derideo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad istum emptum venerunt illum locum senatorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:50:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 50, § 124</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parasitus modo venerat aurum petere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nos Libycos populare penates Venimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:528" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 528</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of inanimate subjects: navis huc ex portu Persico Venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">denique in os salsi venit umor saepe saporis, Cum mare vorsamur propter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) Per patefacta venit penetratque foramina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:891" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 891</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(speculi imago) Dum venit ad nostras acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub aspectum venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:358" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 358</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in conspectum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:48" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 7, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">muliebris vox mihi ad aures venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in Italiā te moraturum, dum tibi litterae meae veniant,</quote> <trans><tr>reaches you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 24, 2</bibl></cit>: hereditas unicuique nostrum venit, <hi rend="ital">comes</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">descends to each of us</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:26:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 26, 74</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic Verres hereditatem sibi venisse arbitratus est, quod in ejus regnum ac manus venerat is, quem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27:section=62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27, § 62</bibl></cit>: hic segetes, illic veniunt felicius uvae, <hi rend="ital">come forth</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">grow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 54</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">arbores sponte suā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; 2, 58; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:2:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 2, 10</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50442.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">we</hi>, <hi rend="ital">they</hi>, etc., <hi rend="ital">came</hi> or <hi rend="ital">have come</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Lilybaeum venitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 141</bibl></cit>: ad me ventum est, <hi rend="ital">it has fallen to me</hi>, id <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ad flumen Varum veniatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Galli) veniri ad se confestim existimantes, ad arma conclamant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventum in insulam est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi eo ventum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad quos ventum erat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 23: eo cum esset ventum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50442.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">to come. spring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be descended</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui se Bebryciā veniens Amyci de gente ferebat (i. e. qui se ferebat venientem, etc.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:373" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 373</bibl></cit> Forbig. ad loc. —</sense><sense id="n50442.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50442.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">vides, quo progrediente oratione venturum me puto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl></cit>. ut jam a principio videndum sit, quemadmodum velis venire ad extremum orationis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:201" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 59, 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">contra rem suam me nescio quando venisse questus est,</quote> <trans><tr>that I appeared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: contra amici summam existimationem, id. <cb n="VENN" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rem nullam habebis, quod in buccam venerit, scribito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 1:12:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. bucca: si quid in mentem veniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 12:36:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 36, 1</bibl></cit>.—So in Cic. with <case>nom.</case> only of <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">res;</hi> but freq. <hi rend="ital">impers.</hi> with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum matronarum ac virginum veniebat in mentem,</quote> <trans><tr>when I thought of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venit enim mihi in mentem oris tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:34:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 34, 95</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 14, 38</bibl>; v. also mens, II. B. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> and the passages there cited: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum laus ita ducta ab humili venit ad summum, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prava ex falsis opinionibus veniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium pejus, quod ex inopiā, quam quod ex copiā venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non omne argumentum undique venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">existimabunt majus commodum ex otio meo quam ex aliorum negotiis reipublicae venturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 4, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi ea dies, quam constituerat cum legatis, venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus victoriae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suum tempus eorum laudi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:1:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sumus omnino sine curā venientis anni,</quote> <trans><tr>for the coming year</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum trahens Perniciem veniens in aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veniens aetas,</quote> <trans><tr>the future</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:639" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 639</bibl></cit>.—Of events, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to happen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod hodie venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50442.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n50442.7" n="1" level="3"> Venire in aliquid (rarely ad aliquid; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <hi rend="ital">to come into</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fall into</hi> any state or condition (so esp. freq.): venisse alicui in amicitiam, <hi rend="ital">to have obtained one's friendship</hi> or <hi rend="ital">alliance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in calamitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cognitionem alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam in consuetudinem ex utilitatis ratione venerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:53:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 53, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in proverbii consuetudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:15:55" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 15, 55</bibl></cit>.—Of a personal subject: <cit><quote lang="la">(milites) qui in consuetudinem Alexandrinae vitae venerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non solum hostibus in contemptionem Sabinus veniret, sed, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>had fallen into contempt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in contentionem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:63:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 63, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si falso venisses in suspitionem, P. Sestio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum in cruciatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut in controversiam aut in contentionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in discrimen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dubium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in alicujus fidem ac potestatem,</quote> <trans><tr>to place one's self under the protection and in the power of a person</tr>, <tr>to surrender at discretion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne in odium veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:24:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 24, 79</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinii nomen huic populo in odium venisse regium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:40:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 40, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse illi perditae multitudini in odium acerbissimum venerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 8, 6</bibl></cit>: in eam opinionem Cassius veniebat, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in partem alicujus,</quote> <trans><tr>to take part in it</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in periculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sermonem alicujus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to enter into conversation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in another sense: cum loquerer cum Phaniā, veni in eum sermonem, ut dicerem, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>I happened to say that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullam in spem veneram, posse me, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam in spem per Helvetios regni obtinendi venire,</quote> <trans><tr>to entertain hopes</tr>, <tr>to hope</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>.— Esp. with <hi rend="ital">res</hi> as subject, <hi rend="ital">the affair came to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reached the point</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">res proxime formam latrocinii venerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:48:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 48, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 56, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res venit prope secessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 42, 10</bibl></cit>. ad ultimum dimicationis rati rem venturam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 56, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum speramus eo rem venturam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 226</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe in eum locum ventum est, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to such a point that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:30:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 30, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50442.8" n="(b)" level="5"> Ad aliquid: bene agis, Alba; <cit><quote lang="la">ad tuam veniam condicionem,</quote> <trans><tr>will accept</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:62:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 62, § 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad summum fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>to attain</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50442.9" n="2" level="3"> In speaking, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi> to a topic: <cit><quote lang="la">ut jam a fabulis ad facta veniamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ad fabulas veniamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 16, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad tertiam epistulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio ad recentiores litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 19, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Arcesilam Carneademque veniamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venio nunc ad tertium genus illud, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:33:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 33, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad istius morbum et insaniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:1:section=1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 1, § 1 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vennenses: <entryFree id="n50443" type="main" key="Vennenses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vennenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vennonius: <entryFree id="n50444" type="main" key="Venno_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vennōnĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman historian whose works are lost</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 2, 6</bibl>. <cb n="VENT" /></sense></entryFree>
venor: <entryFree id="n50445" type="main" key="ve_nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnor</orth>, <itype>ātus</itype> (<sense id="n50445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> parag. venarier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1248</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur. part.</hi> venantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:551 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 551 al.</bibl>), 1, <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hunt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chase</hi> (cf.: capto, aucupor). </sense><sense id="n50445.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui venari solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo me in silvam venatum vocas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venatum in nemus ire parant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canum alacritas in venando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:63:158" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 63, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigris venatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:493" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 493</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu praecipue curvis venare theatris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 89</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia est venatum ducere invitas canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piscari in aëre, Venari autem jaculo in medio mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 1, 1, 87</bibl></cit>.—<mood>Part.</mood> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces venantum,</quote> <trans><tr>of hunters</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50445.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">i modo, venare leporem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canibus leporem, dammas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:410" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 410</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vespae muscas grandiores venantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 21, 24, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conchae hiantes venantur cibum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 154</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugientes cum mari pisces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50445.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to hunt</hi> or <hi rend="ital">seek after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to pursue</hi> a thing (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">laudem modestiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suffragia ventosae plebis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viduas avaras frustis et pomis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros oculis (filia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">amores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 27</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0043,005:335" default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Trag. 335</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 734</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
venosus: <entryFree id="n50446" type="main" key="ve_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vena</etym>, <sense id="n50446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of veins</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veiny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venous.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50446.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">renes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 13, 100, § 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intybum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 29, § 73</bibl></cit>. —* </sense><sense id="n50446.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">liber Acci,</quote> <trans><tr>dry</tr>, <tr>meagre</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:76" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venter: <entryFree id="n50447" type="main" key="venter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">venter</orth>, <itype>tris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. for gventer; cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gasth/r</foreign>; Sanscr. gatharas</etym>. <sense id="n50447.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50447.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">the belly</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus, abdomen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:37:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 82</bibl></cit>. § 207; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div 2, 58, 119</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:26:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 26, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 50, 74, § 157</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50447.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., as the seat of the stomach, conveying the accessory idea of greediness, gormandizing, <hi rend="ital">the paunch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maw</hi>: Cyclopis venter, velut olim turserat alte, Carnibus humanis distentus, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 870</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 326 Vahl.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventri operam dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 128</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:167" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:40" default="NO">11, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proin tu tui cottidiani victi ventrem ad me adferas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an appetite for ordinary food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 75</bibl></cit>: vivite lurcones, comedones, vivite ventres, <hi rend="ital">ye maws</hi>, for <hi rend="ital">ye gluttons</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gormandizers</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 11, 8</bibl>.—In partic.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to have a passage at stool</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 3, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50447.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50447.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The womb</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines in ventre necandos Conducit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:596" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 596</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50447.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The fruit of the womb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fœtus</hi>: ignorans nurum ventrem ferre, Liv 1, 34, 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R.
