R. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:4:3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 5, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:6:1" default="NO">25, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:9:1:section=13" default="NO">37, 9, 1, § 13</bibl>; 29, 2, 30; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:311" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:50" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 50</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50447.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The bowels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">entrails</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:14:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 14, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 20, 23, § 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50447.7" n="C" level="2"> Of any thing that swells or bellies out, <hi rend="ital">a belly</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a swelling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">protuberance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumidoque cucurbita ventre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:2:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 2, 23</bibl></cit> (5, 2, 43); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 122</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lagonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concavus tali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:255" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 46, 106, § 255</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parietis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:5:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae ductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ventidianus: <entryFree id="n50448" type="main" key="Venti^di^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ventĭdĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Ventidius.</entryFree>
ventidius: <entryFree id="n50449" type="main" key="Venti^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ventĭdĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; <cit><quote lang="la">so P. Ventidius Bassus,</quote> <trans><tr>a partisan of Antony</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 21, 48</bibl>; 14, 7, 21; Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 18, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 4</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Ventĭdĭā-nus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Ventidian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Ventidius</hi>: milites, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 13, 3</bibl>: rumores, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 92, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventilabrum: <entryFree id="n50450" type="main" key="venti^la_brum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventĭlābrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>ventilo</etym>, <sense id="n50450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an implement for winnowing grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a winnowing-fork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl>; Prud. Apoth. praef. 2, 53; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 3, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 3, n. 15.</sense></entryFree>
ventilabundus: <entryFree id="n50451" type="hapax" key="venti^la_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventĭlābundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">swinging to and fro</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wavering</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 356, 28</bibl> dub. (al. vertilabundus).</sense></entryFree>
ventilatio: <entryFree id="n50452" type="main" key="venti^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventĭlātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an airing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ventilation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 6, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ventilator: <entryFree id="n50453" type="main" key="venti^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventĭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who winnows grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a winnower.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50453.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50453.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (from tossing up into the air), <hi rend="ital">a juggler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 11</bibl> Spald.; Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 78.</sense></entryFree>
ventilo: <entryFree id="n50454" type="main" key="venti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>ventulus</etym>, <sense id="n50454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to toss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brandish in the air; to fan.</hi> <pb n="1970" /> <cb n="VENT" /> </sense><sense id="n50454.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50454.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">facem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 3, 50: <cit><quote lang="la">arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:31:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 31, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aureos nummos manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126, 14</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam stultum est, cum signum pugnae acceperis, ventilare!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliud est pugnare, aliud ventilare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Excerpt. Contr. 3 praef" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Excerpt. Contr. 3 praef.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum utrumque in diversum latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populeas ventilat aura comas,</quote> <trans><tr>fans</tr>, <tr>sways</tr>, <tr>agitates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incendia (flatus),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to fan</tr>, <tr>inflame</tr>, <tr>kindle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:507" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 507</bibl></cit>: frigus, <hi rend="ital">fans coolness upon him</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">cools him with fanning</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:82:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 82, 10</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestate apertis foribus atque etiam aliquo ventilante cubabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:82" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 82</bibl></cit>: ventilat aestivum digitis sudantibus aurum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">tosses to and fro</hi> (as it were) <hi rend="ital">in order to cool it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:28" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 109</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">alio atque alio positu ventilari,</quote> <trans><tr>to move one's self</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 2:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 2, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50454.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., econom. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to toss</hi> grain <hi rend="ital">into the air</hi>, in order to cleanse it from chaff, <hi rend="ital">to winnow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:30:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:16" default="NO">1, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 30, 73, § 302</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:322" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 32, 75, § 322</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50454.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>: cujus lingua quasi flabello seditionis illa tum est egentium contio ventilata, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 23, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen alicujus pro tribunalibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bring forward</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 337, 30</bibl></cit>: vitam insontium Manibus accitis, Cod. Th. 9, 16, 5; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 9, 18, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventio: <entryFree id="n50455" type="hapax" key="venti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>venio</etym>, <sense id="n50455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a coming</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tibi huc ventio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 61</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ventito: <entryFree id="n50456" type="main" key="venti^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n50456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to come often</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be wont to come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep coming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resort</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">multum ad eos (Ubios) mercatores ventitant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ipse ad Scaevolam ventitarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:4:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:9:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 9, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in castra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 27, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ventitabas, quo puella ducebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad potum (elephanti),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
vento: <entryFree id="n50457" type="hapax" key="vento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vento</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be wont to come</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to come</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventose: <entryFree id="n50458" type="main" key="vento_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. ventosus <sense id="n50458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
ventositas: <entryFree id="n50459" type="main" key="vento_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ventosus</etym> (postclass.). <sense id="n50459.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">windiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatulence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ventosity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 126</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50459.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a puffing up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceit</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventosus: <entryFree id="n50460" type="main" key="vento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ventus</etym>, <sense id="n50460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">windy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50460.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">folles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:449" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 449</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">speluncae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:537" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 537</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 335</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl> (17), 5: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:78" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctumnus, hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 80, § 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 12</bibl></cit> (3, 3), 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:848" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 848</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">concha,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the tuba</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:349" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 349</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbita,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>cupping - glass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:58" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 58</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:269" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 269</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Germania,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:43:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 43, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 309, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50460.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">like the wind</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nimble</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">equi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:392" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 392</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mens cervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 299</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50460.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50460.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Light</hi>, <hi rend="ital">changeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconstant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fickle</hi>: Lepidus homo ventosissimus, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 9, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romae Tibur amem ventosus, Tibure Romam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu levis es multoque tuis ventosior alis (of Cupid),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:9:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 9, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 30, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extraordinarium imperium populare atque ventosum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50460.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Windy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">puffed up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">superbiebat ventosa et insolens natio, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosus et mendax vanitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:708" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 708</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ventoso gloria curru,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:390" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 390</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decus (opp. verus honor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:711" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 711</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventosa et enormis loquacitas,</quote> <trans><tr>inflated</tr>, <tr>bombastic</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 2</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ventōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">as if full of wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflatedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumentes pulvilli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 248, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ventralis: <entryFree id="n50461" type="main" key="ventra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venter</etym>, <sense id="n50461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ventral.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50461.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">umor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 8 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n50461.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrāle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (i. e. cingulum), <hi rend="ital">a belly-band</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 73, § 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:52" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 7, 28, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 20, 6</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
ventricola: <entryFree id="n50462" type="hapax" key="ventri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>venter-colo</etym>, <sense id="n50462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes a god of his belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a belly-god</hi>, <hi rend="ital">glutton</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 86 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
ventriculatio: <entryFree id="n50463" type="hapax" key="ventri^cu^la_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭcŭlātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>ventriculus</etym>, <cb n="VENT" /> <sense id="n50463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the belly-ache</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gripes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:143" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventriculosus: <entryFree id="n50464" type="hapax" key="ventri^cu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭcŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ventriculus</etym>, <sense id="n50464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the belly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">passio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the belly-ache</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:3:48" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 3, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ventricultor: <entryFree id="n50465" type="main" key="ventri^cultor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭcultor</orth>, <itype>oris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = ventricola (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 36:11" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 36, 11</bibl>.</entryFree>
ventriculus: <entryFree id="n50466" type="main" key="ventri^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭcŭlus</orth> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭ-cŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 150, 5</bibl>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>venter</etym>, <sense id="n50466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the belly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50466.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, Aug. ap. Suet. Vit. Aug.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 97</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50466.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50466.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The stomach</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:26:16" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 26, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 200</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50466.4" n="B" level="2"> Cordis, <hi rend="ital">a ventricle</hi> of the heart, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:138" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 138</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventrifluus: <entryFree id="n50467" type="main" key="ventri^flu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭflŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venter-fluo</etym>, <sense id="n50467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">laxative</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purgative</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4:134" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4, 134</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ventrigo: <entryFree id="n50468" type="main" key="ventri^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭgo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = ventrem agere (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 2</bibl>.</entryFree>
ventriloquus: <entryFree id="n50469" type="main" key="ventri^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>venter-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n50469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who speaks from his belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ventriloquist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Prax. 19</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 3, 8, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventriosus: <entryFree id="n50470" type="main" key="ventri^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>venter</etym>, <sense id="n50470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a large belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">big - bellied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pot - bellied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:7:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 7, 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 11</bibl>.—In the collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrŭōsus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">bellying out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventruosa ac patula dolia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 21, 27, § 134</bibl></cit>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">ventrōsus</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> in Psa. 72</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventulus: <entryFree id="n50471" type="main" key="ventu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>ventus</etym>, <sense id="n50471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slight wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breeze</hi> (ante-class.): ventulum facere, <hi rend="ital">to make a breeze</hi> (by fanning), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ventus: <entryFree id="n50472" type="main" key="ventus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ventus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Sanscr. vā, blow; vatas, wind; Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">av-, a)/w, a)/hmi</foreign>, to blow; whence <foreign lang="greek">a)h/r, au)/ra</foreign>, etc.; Goth. vaia, to breathe; vinds, wind</etym>, <sense id="n50472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wind</hi> (syn.: aura, flamen). </sense><sense id="n50472.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus est aëris fluens unda cum incerta motus redundantia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:67" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:16 sq" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 16 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 11</bibl>: istic est is Juppiter quem dico, quem Graeci vocant <foreign lang="greek">*)ae/ra</foreign>, qui ventus est et nubes, imber postea, Atque ex imbre frigus, ventus post fit, aër denuo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=65" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 65</bibl> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(aër) effluens huc et illuc ventos efficit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deturbavit ventus tectum et tegulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:prol. 78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. prol. 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare ventorum vi agitari atque turbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:49:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 49, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (divi) simul Stravere ventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remissior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prosper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:27:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 27, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventum exspectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 3, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 10, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundus, adversus, v. h. vv.—In apposition: Africus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:36:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 36, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atabalus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Septentriones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 16</bibl>.—Prov. </sense><sense id="n50472.2" n="1" level="3"> Of labor lost: <cit><quote lang="la">in vento et aquā scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:70:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 70, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">profundere verba ventis,</quote> <trans><tr>to talk to the wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:931" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 931</bibl></cit> (928); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verba dare in ventos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventis loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50472.3" n="2" level="3"> Rem tradere ventis, <hi rend="ital">to oblivion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 26, 3</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n50472.4" n="3" level="3"> Ventis verba dare, i. q. <hi rend="ital">not to keep one's word</hi> or <hi rend="ital">promise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 25</bibl> Ruhnk. —</sense><sense id="n50472.5" n="4" level="3"> Vento vivere, <hi rend="ital">to live upon wind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">air</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 50, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50472.6" n="5" level="3"> Ventis remis facere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">with all one's might;</hi> v. remus. —</sense><sense id="n50472.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, personified as deities, <hi rend="ital">the winds</hi>: te, Apollo sancte, fer opem; teque, omnipotens Neptune, invoco; Vosque adeo, Venti! Turpil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:34:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 34, 73</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 119 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1230" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1230</bibl> (1228); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17</bibl> (18), 37.—</sense><sense id="n50472.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50472.9" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Windiness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatulence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:30:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 30, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50472.10" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A light stuff</hi>: textilis, Poët. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n50472.11" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the wind</hi>, as a symbol of fortune (favorable or unfavorable), fame, applause, etc.: quicumque venti erunt, ars certe nostra non aberit, <hi rend="ital">however the winds may blow</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">whatever circumstances may arise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 25, 5</bibl>: alios ego vidi ventos; <cit><quote lang="la">alias prospexi animo procellas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 9, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (Caesaris) nunc venti valde sunt secundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">secundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vento aliquo in optimum quemque excitato,</quote> <trans><tr>by raising a storm</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum ventorum, quos proposui, moderator quidam et quasi gubernator (opus est),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of the plans</tr>, <tr>designs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: loqui est coeptus, quo vento proicitur Appius minor, ut indicet, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 8, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorum et contionum ventos colligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:28:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 28, 77</bibl></cit>: omnes intellegimus<cb n="VENU" />  in istis subscriptionibus ventum quendam popularem esse quaesitum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 47, 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venucula: <entryFree id="n50473" type="main" key="ve_nu_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnūcŭla</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnūncŭla</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">vennūcŭla</orth>), <itype>uva</itype>, <sense id="n50473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grapes</hi> fit for preserving, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO">3, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:45:1" default="NO">12, 45, 1</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnīcŭla</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
venula: <entryFree id="n50474" type="main" key="ve_nu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>vena</etym>, <sense id="n50474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small vein</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veinlet.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50474.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n50474.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venulus: <entryFree id="n50475" type="main" key="Ve^nu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Rutulian warrior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sent by Turnus as an ambassador to Diomedes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:457" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 457</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venum: <entryFree id="n50476" type="main" key="ve_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. 2. venus.</entryFree>
venumdo: <entryFree id="n50477" type="main" key="ve_numdo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnum-do</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnun-do</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">vaen-</orth>; also separately, <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnum do</orth>, <sense id="n50477.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <itype>dĕdi, dătum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. venus-do, whence also vendo, by contraction</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to sell</hi>, used chiefly of the sale of captured slaves (not in Cic.) hostes praeter senatores omnes venumdati sunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 29, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo alia civium Campanorum venum data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidae puberes interfecti, alii omnes venundati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:52" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 52</bibl>: tuque, o Minoa venundata Scylla figura, tondes, etc., <hi rend="ital">sold for</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">bribed by</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 19</bibl> (4, 18), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam,</quote> <trans><tr>to put up for sale</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">In tmesi: se venum a principibus datos Poeno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam venum aut dono datum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 17</bibl></cit> Dietsch.</sense></entryFree>
venus: <entryFree id="n50478" type="main" key="Ve^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnus</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype> (<sense id="n50478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. sing.</hi> VENERVS, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1364</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>v. veneror</etym>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess of Love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the goddess Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:23:59 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 23, 59 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 30, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">filius Veneris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cupid</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 463</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 325</bibl>; and in jest, Venere prognatus, of <hi rend="ital">C. Julius Cœar</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Veneris mensis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>April</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:61" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50478.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50478.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sexual love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venery</hi> (as euphemism freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">sine Cerere et Libero friget Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus trivio conmissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 434</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 306</bibl>; 12, 198; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:27:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 27, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n50478.3" n="2" level="3"> Like the Engl. <hi rend="ital">love</hi>, to denote <hi rend="ital">a beloved object</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beloved</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec veneres nostras hoc fallit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 3, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 33, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50478.4" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Qualities that excite love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attractiveness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charms</hi> (<number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): quo fugit venus? quo color? decens Quo motus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac bene nummatum decorat suadela venusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:28:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 28, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fabula nullius veneris sine pondere et arte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 320</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermo ipse Romanus non recipere videatur illam solis concessam Atticis venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod cum gratiā quādam et venere dicatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 18</bibl></cit>; so (with gratia) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:116" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 116</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of paintings: deesse iis unam illam suam venerem dicebat, quam Graeci charita vocant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 79</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">profecto Amoenitates omnium venerum atque venustatum adfero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Isocrates omnes dicendi veneres sectatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50478.5" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The planet Venus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:17:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 17, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50478.6" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The highest throw</hi> at dice, when each of the dice presented a different number, <hi rend="ital">the Venus throw</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 8, 45; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 25</bibl>; Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>; cf. in the foll.—</sense><sense id="n50478.7" n="II" level="1"> Derivv.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĕus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Venus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacerdos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antistita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nepotulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nutricatus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servi,</quote> <trans><tr>temple-slaves of the Erycinian Venus in Sicily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:20:section=50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 54, § 141</bibl>; v. also infra, B. 2.: res, voluptates, etc., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to sexual love</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venereous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venereal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:69:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 69, 143</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">visa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 50, § 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:4:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 4, 3</bibl>; cf. in a pun: homo, <hi rend="ital">belonging to Venus</hi> and <hi rend="ital">lascivious</hi> (of Verres), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">delphinus,</quote> <trans><tr>wanton</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostros quoque antiquiores poëtas amasios et Venerios fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:9:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 19, 9, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of pear</tr>, <tr>Venus-pear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:4" default="NO">12, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 15, 16, § 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50478.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50478.9" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (i. e. jactus), <hi rend="ital">the Venus-throw</hi> at dice (v. supra, I. B. 5.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:13:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 13, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 59, 121</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĕum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: hoc Venereum<pb n="1971" /> <cb n="VENU" />  est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 55</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50478.10" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĕi</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭi</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (i. e. servi), <hi rend="ital">the templeslaves of the Erycinian Venus</hi> (v. supra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:38:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 38, § 92</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 25, § 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 15, 43</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50478.11" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĕae</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnĕrĭae</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (i. e. conchae), <hi rend="ital">a kind of mussels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venus-shell</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 33, 52, § 103</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:151" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 53, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n50479" type="main" key="ve_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">vēnum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vaen-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (occurring only in the forms venui, veno, and venum) [Gr. <foreign lang="greek">w)=nos</foreign>, price; <foreign lang="greek">w)nh/</foreign>, purchase; cf. Sanscr. vasuas, price; vasuam, wages; and perh. Germ. Gewinn], <sense id="n50479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sale.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50479.1" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Dat.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50479.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Form venui (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">rogavit haberetne venui lacte?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 210, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantherium venui subicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 221, 29.—</sense><sense id="n50479.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Form veno (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">posita veno irritamenta luxus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae veno exercerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50479.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> venum (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">dare aliquem venum,</quote> <trans><tr>to sell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venum cuncta dari,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 1, 179</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence the compound venumdo, q. v.: ut ejus familia ad aedem Cereris venum iret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pileatos servos venum solitos ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:4:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venum iturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seque et sua tradita venum Castra videt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venum redibat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venusia: <entryFree id="n50480" type="main" key="Ve^nu^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnŭsĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n50480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town on the borders of Apulia and Lucania</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the birthplace of the poet Horace</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Venosa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 11, 16, § 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:14:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 14, 6</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕnŭsīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Venusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Venusian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:28:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 28, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Horace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucerna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the poetry of Horace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:51" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 51</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Vĕ-nŭsīni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Venusia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Venusians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:10" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venustas: <entryFree id="n50481" type="main" key="ve^nustas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. Venus</etym>, <sense id="n50481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loveliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comeliness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beauty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attractiveness</hi>, etc. (syn.: pulchritudo, formositas). </sense><sense id="n50481.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the body: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pulchritudinis duo genera sint, quorum in altero venustas sit, in altero dignitas, venustatem muliebrem ducere debemus, dignitatem virilem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:36:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 36, 130</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 30, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">venustas et pulchritudo corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voltus quantam affert tum dignitatem, tum venustatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 18, 60</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">signa eximiā venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolii fastigium illud non venustas sed necessitas ipsa fabricata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:46:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pomorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:59:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 59, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50481.2" n="II" level="1"> Of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">homo affluens omni lepore et venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:54:section=142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 54, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratoris est) agere cum dignitate ac venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi vis egregia, summā festivitate et venustate conjuncta profuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 57, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprobari cum dignitate tum etiam venustate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 12, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:118" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 118</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:66" default="NO">9, 2, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:72" default="NO">9, 3, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:20:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 20, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui quidem omnes mores ad venustatem valent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 63</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem pulchrum et venustatis plenum,</quote> <trans><tr>pleasantness</tr>, <tr>pleasure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis me fortunatior, venustatisque adeo plenior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 8</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoenitates omnium venerum atque venustatum affero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 1, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
venuste: <entryFree id="n50482" type="main" key="ve^nuste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. venustus <sense id="n50482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
venusto: <entryFree id="n50483" type="main" key="ve^nusto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnusto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>venustus</etym>, <sense id="n50483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautify</hi>: se unguentis, Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 565, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ideo primo fecit (fidem) deus, postea venustavit, Ambros. Hexaëm. 1, 7, 27: miracula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Luc. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
venustulus: <entryFree id="n50484" type="main" key="ve^nustu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n50484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delightful</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. Idyll. 4</bibl></cit> praem.</sense></entryFree>
venustus: <entryFree id="n50485" type="main" key="ve^nustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. Venus</etym>, <sense id="n50485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lovely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pleasing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">winning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agreeable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graceful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautiful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">elegant</hi>, etc. (syn.: pulcher, formosus, speciosus). </sense><sense id="n50485.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically: <cit><quote lang="la">species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 153</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 93</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus et motus corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:55:203" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 55, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">soror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:89:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 89, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diva venustissima Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">forma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:79" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 79</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanim. things: <cit><quote lang="la">sphaera venustior et nobilior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hortuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sirmio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 31, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspectus figurationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n50485.2" n="II" level="1"> Mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecus facilis et valde venustus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerumque dolor etiam venustos facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: venustum<cb n="VERA" />  esse, quod cum gratiā quādam et venere dicatur apparet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(genus dictionis) sententiosum et argutum, sententiae concinnae et venustae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(antiqua comoedia) grandis et elegans et venusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 61</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines venustiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">longe venustiora omnia in respondendo quam in provocando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">repercutiendi genus venustissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:78" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:46" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 46</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕnustē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">charmingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gracefully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">beautifully</hi>: venuste cecidisse, <hi rend="ital">most delightfully</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">respondere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere mimiambos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispanus hunc colorem venustius (adhibuit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1:1:20" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: quibus venustissime Curio respondit, se, etc., Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 11, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia venustissime fingere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vepallidus: <entryFree id="n50486" type="hapax" key="ve_palli^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē-pallĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n50486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very pallid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
vepraticus: <entryFree id="n50487" type="hapax" key="ve_^pra_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^prātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vepres</etym>, <sense id="n50487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a thorn-bush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
veprecula: <entryFree id="n50488" type="main" key="ve_^pre_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^prēcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n50488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little thorn-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">brier - bush</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa ex vepreculis extracta nitedula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:33:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 33, 72</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: vipera est in vepreculā, <hi rend="ital">there's a viper in the bush</hi>, of a hidden danger, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 231, 13</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 130 Rib.; cf.: latet anguis in herba).</sense></entryFree>
vepres: <entryFree id="n50489" type="main" key="ve_^pres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^pres</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vē^pris</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vĕper</orth>), <itype>is</itype>, and more usu. in the <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">vĕpres</orth>, <itype>ium</itype> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> veprum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 44</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n50489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 62</bibl>; v. Neue, Formenl. 1, pp. 460, 678), <hi rend="ital">a thorn-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brier-bush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bramble-bush</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n50489.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: ARBORES, VITES, VEPRES, SENTES, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcrum septum undique et vestitum vepribus et dumetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 271</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 444</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:645" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 645</bibl>; * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Gen.</hi> veprum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:44" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:60" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 3</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter vepres rosae nascuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 7, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50489.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing. nom.</hi> vepres, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 613</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> hunc veprem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 21, 37, § 116</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veprem et spinam vorabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 9, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">27, 4</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> vepre, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 628</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
vepretum: <entryFree id="n50490" type="main" key="ve_^pre_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vē^prētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vepres</etym>, <sense id="n50490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thornhedge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bramble-thicket</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ver: <entryFree id="n50491" type="main" key="ve_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vēr</orth>, <itype>vēris</itype> (<case>abl.</case> veri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:129" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 129</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e)/ar, h)=r</foreign>, i. e. <foreign lang="greek">vhr</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n50491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the spring.</hi> </sense><sense id="n50491.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 9</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:28:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. R. 1, 28, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 4, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:737" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 737</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:10:section=27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 10, § 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 19, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vere novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 12, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo vere,</quote> <trans><tr>at the beginning of spring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 7, 2</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">vere prius flores, aestu numerabis aristas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50491.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the productions of spring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum breve Cecropiae ver populantur apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:14:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 14, 2</bibl></cit>.—So esp. freq., ver sacrum, <hi rend="ital">a special offering presented from the firstlings of spring</hi>, which it was customary to vow in critical circumstances: <cit><quote lang="la">ver sacrum vovendi mos fuit Italis. Magnis enim periculis adducti vovebant, quaecumque proximo vere nata essent apud se animalia immolaturos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=379" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 379</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. id. s. v. Mamertini, p. 158; id. s. v Sacrani, p. 321; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 522, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ver sacrum vovendum, si bellatum prospere esset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:9:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 9, 10</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">the votive formula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 44, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:44:1" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 44, 1</bibl> sqq. Weissenb. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:4:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 24, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n50491.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the spring-time of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">youth</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jucundum cum aetas florida ver ageret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veraciter: <entryFree id="n50492" type="main" key="ve_ra_ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērācĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. verax <sense id="n50492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
veragri: <entryFree id="n50493" type="main" key="Vera_^gri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Verā^gri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n50493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis, <hi rend="ital">on the Pennine Alps</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 20, 24, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
veratrix: <entryFree id="n50494" type="spur" key="ve_ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, a false read. for veteratrix, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 230</bibl>.</entryFree>
veratrum: <entryFree id="n50495" type="main" key="ve_ra_trum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērātrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n50495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hellebore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 5, 21, § 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:5:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 5, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:12 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 12 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:640" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 640</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:51" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
verax: <entryFree id="n50496" type="main" key="ve_rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">vērax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>verus</etym>, <sense id="n50496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">speaking truly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">true</hi>, <hi rend="ital">veracious</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">si eris verax, tuā ex re facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oraculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:19:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 19, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:41" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:119" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 25, 79</bibl></cit>: visa quietis tranquilla atque veracia, <cb n="VERB" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 29, 61</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Liber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 89</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vosque veraces cecinisse Parcae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:25" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C.
