Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:60" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tergunt, qui ungunt, qui verrunt, qui spargunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par 5, 2, 37</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Stratae passim matres crinibus templa verrentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinibus passis aras verrentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:561" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 561</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Seren 225</bibl>; cf. <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aequora caudis (delphines),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:674" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenas caudā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:701" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 701</bibl></cit>.—Of fishermen: <cit><quote lang="la">retibus aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:262 sq" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 262 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 285</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesariem longa per aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:961" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 961</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">canitiem suam concreto in sanguine,</quote> <trans><tr>dragging</tr>, <tr>draggling</tr>, <tr>trailing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:492" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 492</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50602.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n50602.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to sweep along</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impel</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>); <cit><quote lang="la">verrunt (venti) nubila caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:279" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 279</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verrentes aequora venti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 266</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:388" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 388</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:624" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 624</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:778" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 778</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 7</bibl>: caerula <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 208</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remis vada,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 320</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:572" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 572</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1227</bibl>: nec nostra Actiacum verreret ossa mare, <hi rend="ital">drive</hi> or <hi rend="ital">toss about</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15</bibl> (3, 7), 44 (Müll. verteret).—</sense><sense id="n50602.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To sweep away</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to drag away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carry off</hi> (rare but class.): domi quicquid habet, verritur <foreign lang="greek">e)/cw</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid ponitur, hinc et inde verris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:37:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 37, 1</bibl></cit>. futurum ut omnia verreret Verres, Cic. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 55</bibl> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter reliqua purgamenta scopis coepit verrere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 34</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n50602.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To obliterate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi> (post-Aug. and poët.): <cit><quote lang="la">si decet aurata Bacchum vestigia palla Verrere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 262</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vestigia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 248</bibl></cit>: undosi verrebant bracchia crines, id. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 145. <cb n="VERS" /></sense></entryFree>
